intro: Rudgea minor, commonly known as the small rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Rudgea minor is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and fragrant blooms.
